member.name: M:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.AssignTask(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.String)
member.summary:
Assigns the task to a user, or a group of users based on their system role, or business role. After the assignment, this current activity is archived into the ActivityHistory table for future reference.
This method is only called by the SetStateAndAssign custom activity in the workflow, but should not be called by the developer.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.AssignTaskToApprovers(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary:
Assigns the task to approvers based on the approval hierarchy.
This method is only called by the SetStateAndAssignApprovers custom activity in the workflow, but should not be called by the developer.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.RejectTask
member.summary:
Rejects this task.
This method is called only by the RejectTask activity in a workflow and should not be called directly by the developer.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.ApproveTask
member.summary:
Approves this task.
This method is called only by the ApproveTask activity in a workflow and should not be called directly by the developer.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.SendMessage(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Sends an e-mail or SMS message to the specified recipients based on the specified message template.
It achieves this by calling the OMessageTemplate.GenerateAndSendMessage method. Application developers can all either method, but this method is exposed to the SendMessage workflow activity.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.NotifyAssignedRecipient(LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject)
member.summary:
Sends an e-mail or SMS message to the specified recipients based on the specified message template.
It achieves this by calling the OMessageTemplate.GenerateAndSendMessage method. Application developers can all either method, but this method is exposed to the SendMessage workflow activity.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.AssignedUserNames
member.summary:
Gets a comma-separated list of users who are assigned to this object.
If this object does not have a workflow or state, this property returns a null string.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.AssignedUserPositions
member.summary:
Gets a comma-separated list of positions who are assigned to this object.
If this object does not have a workflow or state, this property returns a null string.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.TaskLocations
member.summary:
Gets the OLocation tracked by this object. This is used by the workflow assignment to assign this object to one or more positions.
Descendant classes should implement this if this object can be assigned to Positions. If no location is associated with this object, return null.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.TaskEquipments
member.summary:
Gets the OEquipment tracked by this object. This is used by the workflow assignment to assign this object to one or more positions.
Descendant classes should implement this if this object can be assigned to Positions. If no location is associated with this object, return null.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.TaskTypeOfService
member.summary:
Gets the OCode (type of service) tracked by this object. This is used by the workflow assignment to assign this object to one or more positions.
Descendant classes should implement this if this object can be assigned to Positions. If no location is associated with this object, return null.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.LogicLayerPersistentObject.TaskAmount
member.summary:
Gets the dollar amount of this task. This is used by the approval assignments to determine the users or positions to assign the object to.
Descendant classes should implement this if this object undergoes approval, and the amount is require to determine the approvers for the object.

member.summary: Represents a location or a folder of locations. The location is a hierarchical structure that may contain the top level location and its break down of sub locations. For example, a building as a top level property may be broken down into levels, and each level may then be broken down further into rooms and units.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.TStoreTransfer
member.summary: Summary description for OStoreTransfer

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer
member.summary: Represents a transfer form that contains a list of items that are to be transfer from one store to another.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.IAutoGenerateRunningNumber
member.summary:
Represents an interface that can be tagged to any persistent object class so that it can have the capability to auto generate running numbers.
This interface should only be used sparingly on top-level objects like contract, work, scheduled work, store adjustment, store check-in, budget adjustment, budget reallocation, purchase orders.
It should never be used on sub-level objects like work cost items, purchase order items, etc, as the generation of running numbers can potentially slow the saving process.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.HasDuplicateTransferItem(LogicLayer.OStoreTransferItem)
member.summary:
Check if there is a duplicate item in the list check-out items. An item is duplicate if another item with the same selected Catalogue and Bin is in the list.
Returns false if no duplicates are found.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.ValidateSufficientItemsForTransfer
member.summary: Validates if there are sufficient items in the store for transfer before committing the transfer. Returns true if there are sufficient items in the store, false, if at least one item is insufficient.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.Commit
member.summary: Commits the transfer. Once this method is called, no items in the StoreTransferItems list should be modified.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the check-in and saves to the database. The cancellation can take place only if there are no other transactions on the store bin items other than the one that was created by the check in.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.ValidateCancellable
member.summary: Validates and checks that this check in can be cancelled, that is, there must be no other transactions other than the one created by the check in.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.FromStoreID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Store table that indicates the store to transfer items from.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.ToStoreID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Store table that indicates the store to transfer items to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.Description
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description of the transfer.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.IsCommitted
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag indicating whether this transfer has been committed.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.FromStore
member.summary: Gets or sets the OStore object that represents the store to transfer items from.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.ToStore
member.summary: Gets or sets the OStore object that represents the store to transfer items to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreTransfer.StoreTransferItems
member.summary: Gets a one-to-many list of OStoreTransferItem objects that represents the items to be transfer.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.TStoreItem
member.summary: Summary description for OStoreItem Catalogue item that could be store in the store. Actual item with its quantity will be reflected in the storebin object

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OStoreItem
member.summary: Represents a record containing information about the item that its containing store currently keeps. This information include the cost accounting method (FIFO/LIFO) and whether or not the item is stocked, or non-stocked.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.IsDeactivatable
member.summary:
This object is only deactivable if it has not been saved.
Returns true if deactivable, false otherwise. The UIGridview makes use of this field to hide and show the DeleteObject button accordingly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.HasItems(System.Guid)
member.summary: Checks to see if the store bin with the specified storeBinId has any items currently held in the bin.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.Saving
member.summary: Overrides the saving method to update the StoreBinItems with the same CatalogueID as this StoreItem to update their unit prices, if the Costing Type of this StoreItem has been set up as Standard Costing.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.LastNotificationDate
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the last date/time a reminder notification was sent when the quantity this item fell below threshold.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.StoreID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Store that indicates the store that this store item record belongs to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.CatalogueID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the CatalogueID table to indicate the catalogue the item in this record belongs to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.CostingType
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the costing type, or the accounting method of an item of this catalogue in this store.
0 / StoreItemCostingType.FIFO: First-in-first-out
1 / StoreItemCostingType.LIFO: Last-in-first-out
3 / StoreItemCostingType.StandardCosting: Standard costing
4 / StoreItemCostingType.AverageCosting: Average costing

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.ItemType
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value to indicate whether this item is checked for low-inventory.
0 / StoreItemType.Stocked: If the quantity for this item falls below threshold, it can be re-ordered.
1 / StoreItemType.NonStocked: This item will never be re-ordered even if it falls to zero.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.StandardCostingUnitPrice
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the standard unit price of this item applicable if the costing type is Standard Costing.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.ReorderDefault
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the quantity to re-order if the quantity of this item falls below threshold.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreItem.ReorderThreshold
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the threshold, so that if the quantity of this item in the store falls below this threshold, it is considered to be low, and a re-order can take place.

member.summary: Check if the work cost entered is a duplicate work cost. Returns true if so, false otherwise.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.Deactivating
member.summary:
When deactivating or cancelling this schedule, deactivate all works below it as well.
Note that only works without an actual end date (completion date) will be deactivated.

member.summary: Reorders the cycle numbers for the checklist items.

member.summary: Deactivates and cancels all works attached to this scheduled work.

member.summary: Cancels the scheduled work and deactivates all works.

member.summary:
Creates a list of staggered equipment and location.
Any previous list will be cleared.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.CreateWorksBySchedulerService
member.summary: Sets up the scheduled work so that the scheduler service can create the works for the next cycle.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.CreateWorksForNextCycle(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a set of works for the next cycle. This method is called by the scheduler service.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.EquipmentID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Equipment table that indicates the top-level equipment that works generated by this scheduled work will be based on. This does not indicate the equipment associated with the generated works. The ScheduledWorkEquipment / ScheduledWorkStaggeredEquipment is the property that will indicate those equipment.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.LocationID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Location table that indicates the top-level equipment that works generated by this scheduled work will be based on. This does not indicate the location associated with the generated works. The ScheduledWorkLocation / ScheduledWorkStaggeredLocation is the property that will indicate those location.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.ContractID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Contract table that indicates the term contract that can be used to generate scheduled works.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WorkDescription
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description of the generated works.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.TypeOfWorkID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the type of work of this scheduled work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.TypeOfServiceID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the type of service of this scheduled work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.TypeOfProblemID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the type of problem of this scheduled work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.Priority
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the priority of the generated works.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.EquipmentLocation
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether works generated from this schedule work object are for equipment or for locations.
0 - Generate works for equipment
1 - Generate works for location

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.EquipmentTypeID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the EquipmentType table that indicates the type of equipment to generate works for. This is applicable if EquipmentLocation = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.LocationTypeID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the LocationType table that indicates the type of location to generate works for. This is applicable if EquipmentLocation = 1.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.IsStaggered
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the works generated for the same cycle is staggered (or spread apart so they do not all fall on the same day).
0 - All works for the same cycle are scheduled on the same day.
1 - Works for the same cycle are staggered, and the staggering is specified in ScheduledWorkStaggeredEquipment/ScheduledWorkStaggeredLocation.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.StaggerBy
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the unit to stagger the works by.
0 - Daily
1 - Weekly
2 - Monthly
3 - Yearly

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.SupervisorID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the User table that indicates who the supervisor is for the generated works.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.FirstWorkStartDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the starting date/time of the first work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.FirstWorkEndDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the end date/time of the first work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.FrequencyCount
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets how often the works should be repeated. This only specifies a value, and must be used together with FrequencyInterval to determine the number of days/weeks/months/years.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.FrequencyInterval
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets unit (day/week/month/year) the works should be repeated. This must be used together with FrequencyCount to determine the number of days/weeks/months/years. The default is months.
0 - Day(s)
1 - Week(s)
2 - Month(s)
3 - Year(s)

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.IsFloating
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the works generated is based on a floating schedule, or based on a fixed schedule.
0 - Fixed schedule: all works are created based on a fixed date.
1 - Floating schedule: the next work is created after the previous is completed, and the next work's start date/time is based on the previous' completion date/time. Car servicing is an example of a floating schedule.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekType
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates how a weekly works are scheduled for subsequent works. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly).
0 - Same day as the day of the first work's start
1 - Specific days of the week as specified in the WeekTypeDay0 values.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekTypeDay0
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next work can be scheduled on a Sunday. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly) and WeekType = 1 (specific days of the week).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekTypeDay1
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next work can be scheduled on a Monday. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly) and WeekType = 1 (specific days of the week).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekTypeDay2
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next work can be scheduled on a Tuesday. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly) and WeekType = 1 (specific days of the week).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekTypeDay3
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next work can be scheduled on a Wednesday. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly) and WeekType = 1 (specific days of the week).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekTypeDay4
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next work can be scheduled on a Thursday. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly) and WeekType = 1 (specific days of the week).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekTypeDay5
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next work can be scheduled on a Friday. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly) and WeekType = 1 (specific days of the week).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.WeekTypeDay6
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the next work can be scheduled on a Saturday. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 1 (weekly) and WeekType = 1 (specific days of the week).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.MonthType
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value to indicate how monthly works are scheduled for subsequent works. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 2 (monthly).
0 - Same date (as the date of the first work) every month
1 - Based on specific week/day of the month, as defined by the MonthTypeWeekNumber/MonthTypeDay values.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.MonthTypeWeekNumber
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates the week number to generate subsequent works for the monthly scheduling. This is applicable only if FrequencyInterval = 2 (monthly) and MonthType = 1 (specific week/day)
1 - First week of the month
2 - Second week of the month
3 - Third week of the month
4 - Fourth week of the month
5 - Last week of the month

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.MonthTypeDay
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates the day of the week to generate subsequent works for monthly scheduling.
0 - Sunday
1 - Monday
2 - Tuesday
3 - Wednesday
4 - Thursday
5 - Friday
6 - Saturday

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.IsScheduledByOccurrence
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates how the scheduling will end.
0 - End when date of work reaches a specified end date
1 - End after a total number of cycles have been generated.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.EndDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time that works should not exceed. This is applicable only if IsScheduledByOccurrence = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.EndNumberOfOccurrences
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the number of occurrences / cycles of works that should be created. This is applicable only if IsScheduledByOccurrence = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.CalendarID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Calendar table that indicates the calendar that will be used to identify blocked dates (holidays, non-working days) during the scheduling of the work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.CalendarBlockMethod
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates how to treat works that fall into the block dates specified by the calendar of this scheduled work.
0 - Cancel work if there the work falls on a blocked date.
1 - Move work forward by one calendar day. (The scheduler will keep moving the work forward by 1 day until it is a non-blocked date)
2 - Move work backward by one calendar day. (The scheduler will keep moving the work backward by 1 day until it is a non-blocked date)

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.SchedulerInProgress
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates if this scheduled work is still generating work orders.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.SchedulerChecklistCount
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates the current scheduler checklist count. This value also indicates the number of cycles of works created so far.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.SchedulerStartDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates the next cycle's start date/time.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.SchedulerEndDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates the next cycle's end date/time.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.IsCreated
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not this Scheduled Work has entered the Created state.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.IsCancelled
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not this Scheduled Work has entered the Cancelled state.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.IsAllFixedWorksCreatedAtOnce
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether this Scheduled Work will create all fixed works at once.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OScheduledWork.NumberOfDaysInAdvanceToCreateFixedWorks
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the number of days to create the next cycle of works in advance, where the starting date of each cycle is the date the works are scheduled to start (if there is no staggering).
Note that works that are staggered from the start of a cycle date will also be created, as long as they belong to the same cycle, even if they are scheduled to start later in time because of the staggering.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.TCode
member.summary: Summary description for OCode

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OCode
member.summary:
Represents codes that can be attached to other objects for categorization. Examples of codes are work types, types of service, caller types, vendor classification.
Code Types are declared hierarchically, and so the hierarchical structure of the type of Code objects will also follow the Code Types.
As these codes can be entered by the user at the front end through the Code module, there should be as little logic tied to these codes as possible.

Returns a flag indicating whether the OPC AE server object can be deactivated. It can be deactivated if:

member.summary: Gets a list of all OPC AE servers.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description of the AE server.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag indicating whether this receiving events from this AE server is enabled.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OOPCAEServer.SampleIntervalInMinutes
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the sampling interval in the number of minutes. For performance reasons, this applies to all points in this OPC AE Server group.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OOPCAEServer.BufferTimeInMilliseconds
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the buffer is in milliseconds. This tells the server how often to send event notifications. This is a minimum time - do not send event notifications any faster that this is greater than 0, in which case the server will send an event notification sooner to obey the dwMaxSize parameter.
A value of 0 means that the server should send event notifications as soon as it gets them. This parameter along with the dwMaxSize parameter are used to improve communications efficiency between client and server.
This parameter is a recommendation from the client, and the server is allowed to ignore the parameter.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OOPCAEServer.MaxNumberOfEventsPerCallback
member.summary:
[Column] The requested maximum number of events that will be sent in a single callback. A value of 0 means that there is no limit to the number of events that will be sent in a single callback.
Note that a value greater than 0, may cause the server to call the OnEvent callback more frequently than specified in the BufferTime parameter when a large number of events are being generated in order to limit the number of events to the MaxSize.
This parameter is a recommendation from the client and the server is allowed to ignore this parameter.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OOPCAEServer.NumberOfMinutesToKeepHistory
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the number of minutes to keep the reading history. For performance reasons, this applies to all points in this OPC AE Server group.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OOPCAEServer.OPCAEEvents
member.summary: Gets a list of OPoint objects represent the list of points associated with this OPC AE server.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OOPCAEServer.ReceivingEventsEnabledText
member.summary: Returns a string of text representing whether receiving events from this AE server is enabled.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OChecklistItem
member.summary:
Represents an item that specifies an action to be performed or an item that must be inspected. Examples of checklist items are "Clean the air-conditioning filter," or "Check if the EXIT signs of the buildings meet the statutory requirements."
The user who performs the actions in a checklist may then indicate a response either by choosing it from a list of choices, or by typing a free-text comment.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OApplicationSetting.Saved
member.summary:
Overrides the saved method for this application domain to reflect the new settings immediately.
Application domains that this object was not saved in will not use the new settings until the application is restarted. For example, services and web applications in a server farm must be restarted manually in order for the new settings to take effect.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OPoint
member.summary:
Represents a condition-monitored point in which the readings from any source can be tested against acceptable limits set up against this point. When the reading exceeds the acceptable limits, this can be set up to generate a Work object.
This point can also be associated with an OPC DA server, so that the OPC service can retrieve readings automatically from the OPC server.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPoint.ValidateNoDuplicateLocation
member.summary: Validates that there is no other point with the same location and location type parameter.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPoint.ValidateNoDuplicateEquipment
member.summary: Validates that there is no other point with the same equipment and equipment type parameter.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPoint.ThresholdBreached(LogicLayer.OReading)
member.summary:
This method is called when an alarm matching the conditions is raised.
You can override the implementation of this method to derive more functionality whenever the threshold is breached.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.Description
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description of this point.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag indicating whether or not the point is applicable for a location or for an equipment.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Location table that represents the location that this point is attached to. The point can only be attached to either a Location or an Equipment but not both.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the LocationTypeParameter table that represents the parameter that this point represents.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the EquipmentTypeParameter table that represents the parameter that this point represents.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.CreateWorkOnBreach
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether a work will be created when the reading breaches the acceptable range.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.MinimumAcceptableReading
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the minimum value for the range of acceptable values. If a reading from the point falls outside of the acceptable range, it is considered a breach.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.MaximumAcceptableReading
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the maximum value for the range of acceptable values. If a reading from the point falls outside of the acceptable range, it is considered a breach.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.NumberOfBreachesToTriggerAction
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the number of consecutive breaches before a Work will be created.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.NumberOfBreachesSoFar
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the number of breaches so far. If the next reading is within the acceptable values, this value will be reset to zero.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.CreateOnlyIfWorksAreCancelledOrClosed
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag that indicates if a work should be created if existing works created by this point are cancelled or closed.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the code table that indicates the type of work of the Work that will be created if the readings breach the acceptable range.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the code table that indicates the type of service of the Work that will be created if the readings breach the acceptable range.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the code table that indicates the type of problem of the Work that will be created if the readings breach the acceptable range.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.Priority
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the code table that indicates the priority of the Work that will be created if the readings breach the acceptable range.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPoint.WorkDescription
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the code table that indicates the description of the Work that will be created if the readings breach the acceptable range.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the code used to generate all running numbers for this

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORunningNumberGenerator.RunningNumberBehavior
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets how the running numbers are generated.
0 - Consecutive running numbers that increments by 1 each time it is generated, regardless of the date.
1 - Consecutive running numbers that increments by 1 for the same month and restarts from 1 for a new month.
2 - Consecutive running numbers that increments by 1 for the same year and restarts from 1 for a new year.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORunningNumberGenerator.IsLocationOrEquipmentCodeAdded
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether the location's or equipment's code should be added to the running number. If an object has an equipment defined, the equipment's code will always override the location's code.

member.summary: Represents the different types of running numbers.

member.name: F:LogicLayer.RunningNumberIncrementBehavior.IncrementForever
member.summary: The running number increments forever, regardless of the date.

member.name: F:LogicLayer.RunningNumberIncrementBehavior.ResetEveryMonth
member.summary: The running number increments each time it is generated, but resets itself in a new month.

member.name: F:LogicLayer.RunningNumberIncrementBehavior.ResetEveryYear
member.summary: The running number increments each time it is generated, but resets itself in a new year.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.TWork
member.summary: Summary description for OVendor

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OWork
member.summary:
Represents a work object, or a work instruction used to instruct an in-house team of maintenance staff or external contractors to carry out repair works and routine maintenance works.
It should be noted that all work objects are never associated with any costs outlay that the company has to bear. All costs associated with this work are indirect and are paid by other means. For example, costs of maintenance contractors are paid through upfront warranty or insurance-type of contracts; costs of in-house maintenance staff are paid through their regular salary; costs of materials are paid through purchase into stores.
Thus, costs associated with this work are considered costs of maintenance, and are not directly payable through the finance..

members.member:
--------------------------------------------------------------
Get a data table of all the works currently attached to this scheduled work. Primarily used for Gantt chart display
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
Creates a new work order if there is a scheduled work that created this work, and the scheduled work is based on floating scheduling.
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
Get the applicable service level detail that applies to this work. The applicable service level detail is based on: - Type of Service - Location - Priority
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
Lock and unreserve all store items currently set up in the work's work cost.
Once this method is called, the application should not update the work cost anymore.
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
This method validates if there are sufficient store items in the store to meet the check-out requests of all work cost line items in this work order.
An item can be checked-out without restrictions provided it was previously reserved (up to the quantity it was reserved). If, however, the quantity to be checked out, is more than the quantity reserved, or if there was no reservation at all, then this method checks to ensure that the store's physical balance - total reservations >= the additional items requested for check out. If the condition holds true, the check-out can proceed. If the condition is false, the workflow prevents the check-out, and throws a validation error.
Rewrite another method, if the required logic is different.
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
Validate that for each work cost item that is a material, that the store bin and catalogue id must be specified.
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
Validate that for each work cost item that is a material, that the store bin and catalogue id must be specified.
--------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.LocationID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Location table that indicates the location this work is associated with.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.EquipmentID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Equipment table that indicates the equipment this work is associated with. If this value is not null, then the LocationID must be the same as the equipment's LocationID at the time this work is created.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ChecklistID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Checklist table that indicates the checklist that is attached to this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.Priority
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value to indicate the priority of this work. The higher the number, the higher the priority.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.WorkDescription
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description of the work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.TypeOfWorkID
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the type of work this work is classified under.
Type of work usually refers to a broad classification like corrective maintenance, preventive maintenance, etc.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.TypeOfServiceID
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the type of service this work is classified under.
Type of service usually refers to a broad classification of nature of the problem, for example: Lighting; Electrical; Mechanical; Escalator; Lift, etc.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.TypeOfProblemID
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the type of problem this work is classified under.
Type of problem usually refers to a detailed classification of nature of the problem related to the type of service, for example, where type of service is Light, type of problem can be one of the following: Light bulb blown; Lights flickering; whereas under Lifts, the type of problem can be one of the following: Lift door jammed; lift broken down; lift buttons malfunctioning; etc.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.SupervisorID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the User table that indicates the user who will be responsible for overseeing the progress of the work, and closing it as well.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ApproverID
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the User table that indicates the user who will be responsible for approving the work, if the estimated cost of the work goes beyond the 'work cost limit' of the supervisor of this work.
Note that in the default Anacle.EAM the work can only be submitted for approval only if it goes into planning stage, and the total estimated cost of work exceeds the supervisor's work cost limit.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ScheduledStartDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time this work is scheduled to start.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ScheduledEndDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time this work is scheduled to end.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ActualStartDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the actual starting date/time this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ActualEndDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the actual end date/time this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ResolutionDescription
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a description on how the problem was resolved.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.CauseOfProblemID
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates cause of the problem this work is classified under.
The cause of problem refers to the classification of the diagnosis related to the type of problem. For example, if the type of problem as 'Lighting not working,' the cause of problem could be due to one of the following: Power Failure, Lighting Bulb Blown, Power Not Turned On.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ResolutionID
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the resolution to the problem this work is classified under.
The resolution refers to the classification of the action taken to fix the problem. For example, if the type of problem as 'Power Failure,' the resolution could one of the following: Reset Fuse, Reset Generator, Contacted Power Company, etc.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.PercentageComplete
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates how much of the work is complete (in percentage).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ContractID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Contract table that indicates the contract that this work is associated with.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.IsChargedToCaller
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether this work should be charged to the caller. This is normally used in tenant / landlord scenarios where works to a unit may incur a charge that can be recovered from the tenant.
0 - No, this work will not be charged to the caller.
1 - Yes, this work will be charged to the caller.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.IsEquipmentDown
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the equipment' associated with the work was shut down or out of operation during the duration of the work. This allows us to track the down time of the equipment.
0 - No, the equipment was not shut down or out of operation.
1 - Yes, the equipment was shut down or out of operation.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.GeneratedByPointID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Point table that represents the breached point that generated this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.GeneratedByReadingID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Reading table that represents the reading that breached the point that generated this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.GeneratedByOPCAEEventID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the OPCAEEvent table that represents the event trigger that generated this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.GeneratedByOPCAEEventHistoryID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the OPCAEEventHitosyr table that represents the event history that generated this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.EquipmentDownStartDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time the equipment that was shut down or out of operation. This is applicable only if IsEquipmentDown = 1.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.EquipmentDownEndDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time the equipment that brought back up into operation. This is applicable only if IsEquipmentDown = 1.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.AcknowledgementDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time this work was acknowledged. Note in the default Anacle.EAM, that the acknowledgement date/time can be set by a user who has access to this work during the work in progress and pending closure statuses.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.AcknowledgementDateTimeLimit
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time this work must be acknowledged by, before the work is considered to have failed the service level limit for acknowledgement.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ArrivalDateTime
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time the contractor or in-house maintenance team arrived on-site. Note in the default Anacle.EAM, that the arrival date/time can be set by a user who has access to this work during the work in progress and pending closure statuses.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.ArrivalDateTimeLimit

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWork.CompletionDateTimeLimit
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the date/time this work must be completed. by, before the work is considered to have failed the service level limit for completion.

Generates the message from the current message template and sends it out to the recipients.
You may indicate multiple recipients for e-mail and SMS by separating the receipient e-mail address and cellphone numbers with a comma (,) or a semi-color (;).

The workflow will use the ObjectTypeName and the StateName property to decide the message template to be used to send notification to the assigned recipients of the workflow task.

member.summary:

member.summary: Checks if the transactions are possible based on the available balances in the budget periods.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OBudgetPeriod.NumberOfMonthsPerInterval
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the number of months per interval. This value must be set in such a way that the total number of intervals must not be greater than 36.
In most budget implementations, a yearly budget of 12 months is often broken down into monthly intervals,

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OBudgetPeriod.BudgetID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Budget table that indicates which budget this budget period belongs under.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OBudgetPeriod.StartDate
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the starting date this budget is valid from. Only expenditures created after the start date can commit against this budget period.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OBudgetPeriod.EndDate
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the ending date this budget is valid to. Only expenditures created after the start date can commit against this budget period.
Having a flexible end date allows for the creation of project budgets, so that the validity of the budget is not restricted to an annual or a monthly boundary.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OBudgetPeriod.ClosingDate
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the closing date of this budget period. This indicates the last system date that expenses or POs can be committed against this budget period.

member.summary: Gets or sets a OBudget object that indicates the budget that this budget period belongs under.

member.summary: Gets the total number of intervals in this budget period.

member.summary: Represents the budget distributions in a purchase request, request for quotation or a purchase order object.

member.summary: Creates a list of budget transaction logs from the specified list of purchase budget distributions.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget.GetBudgetTransactionLogs(Anacle.DataFramework.DataList{LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget})
member.summary: Gets all budget transaction logs.

member.summary: Sets the purchase budget transaction log's transaction types.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget.TransferPurchaseBudgets(Anacle.DataFramework.DataList{LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary:
Transfer all budget transactions that belongs to the specified itemNumber to another document.
This mehtod is called when an RFQ is copied to a PO.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget.TransferPartialPurchaseBudgets(Anacle.DataFramework.DataList{LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Decimal})
member.summary:
Transfers partial budget transaction log amounts to another document. This method is used to transfer PO budget commitments to an invoice (which can be a partial amount of the PO).
Once the partial amounts have been deducted from the previous document's transaction logs, new PurchaseBudget objects with the transaction logs will be created for this document.
This mehtod is called when a PO is matched to an Invoice.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget.ClearBudgetTransactionLogs(Anacle.DataFramework.DataList{LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget})
member.summary:
Deactivates all budget transactions that belongs to the specified itemNumber, but it does not transfer the amount back to the originating purchase document.
This method is called when (a) an RFQ is rejected or closed, (b) a PO is rejected or closed, (c) an Invoice is rejected.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget.UndoTransferBudgetTransactionLogs(Anacle.DataFramework.DataList{LogicLayer.OPurchaseBudget})
member.summary:
Deactivates all budget transactions that belongs to the specified itemNumber, and transfer the amount back to the originating purchase document.
This method is called when (a) an RFQ is rejected or closed, (b) a PO is rejected or closed, (c) an Invoice is rejected.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.TStoreCheckIn
member.summary: Summary description for OStoreCheckIn Represent one check in batch of items into the store

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn
member.summary: Represents a check-in form that contains a list of items that are to be checked in to a single store.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.Commit
member.summary: Commit the check-in and saves to the database. Once this method is called, the CheckInItems list must not be modified.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel the check-in and saves to the database. The cancellation can take place only if there are no other transactions on the store bin items other than the one that was created by the check in.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.ValidateCancellable
member.summary: Validates and checks that this check in can be cancelled, that is, there must be no other transactions other than the one created by the check in.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.ValidateNoDuplicateEquipmentName(LogicLayer.OStoreCheckInItem)
member.summary: Validates that there are no equipment with the same name under the same parent.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.StoreID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Store table that indicates the store to check items in to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.Description
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description of this check in.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.IsCommitted
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag indicating whether this check in has been committed.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.Store
member.summary: Gets or sets the OStore object that represents the store items will be checked in to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OStoreCheckIn.CheckInItems
member.summary: Gets a one-to-many list of O objects that represents a list of items that will be checked in.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem
member.summary: Represents

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.RequestForQuotationID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the RequestForQuotation table that indicates the request for quotation object that contains this item.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.ItemNumber
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the item number of this purchase request item.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.ItemType
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates the type this item belongs to.
0 - Material
1 - Services
2 - Others

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.ItemDescription
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description of this item. This description is filled up with the material's (catalogue) or service's (fixed rate) name. If ItemType = 2, however, this description is entered by the user manually through the user interface.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.CatalogueID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Catalogue table that indicates the material item requested. This is applicable if ItemType = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.FixedRateID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the FixedRate table that indicates the service item requested. This is applicable if ItemType = 1.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.UnitOfMeasureID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the unit of measure of this material or service.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.QuantityRequired
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the quantity of the material or service ordered from the vendor.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.PurchaseRequestItemID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the PurchaseRequestItem table that indicates the purchase request item this purchase order item was copied from.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.ReceiptMode
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the mode that this purchase order item should be received in.
0 - Receive quantity
1 - Receive dollar amount

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.AwardedVendorID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Vendor table that represents the vendor that this line item is awarded to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.CurrencyID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Currency table that represents the currency that the awarded vendor is quoting in.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.QuantityProvided
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the quantity provided by the vendor awarded this item.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.UnitPriceInSelectedCurrency
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the awarded unit price of this item in the selected currency.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.UnitPrice
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the awarded unit price of this item in base currency.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.UnitOfMeasure
member.summary: Gets or sets the OCode object that represents the unit of measure of this material or service.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.Catalogue
member.summary: Gets or sets the OCatalogue object that represents the material item requested. This is applicable if ItemType = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.FixedRate
member.summary: Gets or sets the OFixedRate object that represents the service item requested. This is applicable if ItemType = 1.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.AwardedVendor
member.summary: Gets or sets the OVendor object that represents the vendor awarded this line item in the request.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.RequestForQuotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the ORequestForQuotation object that represents the request for quotation object that contains this item.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.PurchaseRequestItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the OPurchaseRequestItem object that represents the purchase request item this request for quotation item was copied from.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.Currency
member.summary: Gets or sets the OCurrency object that represents the currency this line item is quoted in.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.ReceiptModeText
member.summary: Gets the text of the mode of receipt for this purchase order item.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.ItemTypeText
member.summary: Gets the localized text for the item type.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.PurchaseOrderItem
member.summary: Gets the purcahse order item that this request for quotation item was copied to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.CopiedFromObjectNumber
member.summary: Gets the purchase request number that this request for quotation item was copied from.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.CopiedToObjectNumber
member.summary: Gets the purchase order number that this request for quotation item was copied to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotationItem.Subtotal
member.summary: Gets the sub total awarded for this line item. The sub-total is the unit price (in base currency) multiplied by the quantity provided.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem
member.summary: Represents the record that contains information about the quantity of the item received from the vendor. This is associated one of the line items of the purchase order line items.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.Saving
member.summary: Check in as a store item, if the purchase order item was of a material type.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.PurchaseOrderReceiptID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the PurchaseOrderReceipt table that indicates the receipt that contains this item.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.PurchaseOrderItemID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the PurchaseOrderItem table that indicates the item in the purchase order this receipt item is associated with.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.UnitPrice
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the unit price or the dollar amount delivered for this item. This is editable if the receipt mode of the item is dollar amount.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.QuantityDelivered
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the quantity delivered for this item. This is editable if the receipt mode of the item is quantity.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.ExpiryDate
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the expiry date of this batch of items if applicable. When checking in materials into the store, this value will be copied to the item batch's details.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.LotNumber
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the lot number of this batch of items if applicable. When checking in materials into the store, this value will be copied to the item batch's details.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.PurchaseOrderReceipt
member.summary: Gets or sets the O object that represents

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OPurchaseOrderReceiptItem.PurchaseOrderItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the OPurchaseOrderItem object that represents the purchase order this receipt item is associated with.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseInvoice.SubmitForApproval
member.summary:
Submits the Invoice for approval by doing:
1. Creates the budget transaction logs.
2. Creates the budget summaries and stamp them with the current budget available balance.
This method is called from the workflow. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseInvoice.Approve
member.summary:
Approves the Invoice by doing the following:
1. Update all budget transactions to indicated Approved.
2. Create budget summaries if not already created.
3. Stamp budget summaries with current budget balance at approval.
This method is called from the workflow. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseInvoice.Reject
member.summary:
Rejects the Invoice by doing the following: 1. Cancels all budget transactions. 2. Clears all budget summaries.
This method is called from the workflow. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OPurchaseInvoice.Cancel
member.summary:
Cancels the Invoice by doing the following:
1. Unlink all PO line items from RFQ / PR line items.
2. Cancel all PO budget transactions.
3. Undo the transfer of the previous RFQ budget transactions.
This method is called from the workflow. It should not be called by the developer directly.

This differs from the normal Path property in that it shows the path of the entire tree if the

member.name: T:LogicLayer.InventoryCatalogType
member.summary: Contains values enumerating all inventory catalog types.

member.name: F:LogicLayer.InventoryCatalogType.Consumable
member.summary:
A consumable inventory. Consumables are inventory that can be consumed in a Work object for maintenance. They cannot be issued to an Issue Location store.
Each consumable inventory is a collection and individual items are not tracked separately.
Examples of consumables are bulbs, lamps, wires and other spare parts.

member.name: F:LogicLayer.InventoryCatalogType.NonConsumable
member.summary:
A non-consumable inventory. Non-consumables are inventory that cannot be consumed in a Work object for maintenance. They can be issued to an Issue Location store.
Each non-consumable is a collection, and individual items are not tracked separately.
Examples of non-consumables are chairs, tables, television, and minor equipment.

member.name: F:LogicLayer.InventoryCatalogType.Equipment
member.summary:
An equipment inventory. Equipment are capital expenditure items that cannot be used in a Work object for maintenance. They can be issued to an Issue Location store.
Each equipment inventory represents 1 unit of that equipment. Multiple equipment in the same store are represented by multiple StoreBinItem records.
Examples of non-consumables are chairs, tables, television, and minor equipment.

1 - A minimum number of quotations is preferred. A warning is displayed if the minimum quotations is not satisfied.
2 - A minimum number of quotations is required.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.ORunningNumber
member.summary: Represents sets of running numbers used by various modules throughout the system. This class also contains methods for other modules to automatically generate different sets of running numbers by specifying an 'running number type' identifier.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORunningNumber.GenerateNextNumber(System.DateTime,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method creates a global running number based on the object type specified, the prefixes, and the last generated month/year number. The date the running number is generated for. The persistent object type name Any prefixes generated that requires a different sequence of numbers. Returns the running number as an integer

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORunningNumber.GenerateNextNumber(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
This method creates a global running number based on the type specified, and the last generated month/year number.
The format string should specify the output format of the string, for example: NV-{2:00}{1:00}-{0:0000}? where
{0} is the running Number
{1} is the month
{2} is the year
The following are some examples on how to use this method: string NewPONumber = ORunningNumber.GenerateNextNumber("PurchaseOrder", "PO-{2:00}{1:00}-{0:0000}", true); The above will generate something like: "PO-0709-1234"
string NewPONumber = ORunningNumber.GenerateNextNumber("PurchaseOrder", "PO-{4:00}{1:00}-{0:0000}", false); The above will generate something like: "PO-200709-1234"
member.param: The type of running number.
The C# format string for the output.
A flag to indicate whether the year should be generated in two digits, or four digits.
member.returns: The running number in a format that is specified using the formatString.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the name of the persistent object type.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the prefixes associated with this running number entry.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the last number that was generated for this set.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the month the last number for this set was generated.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.ORunningNumber.LastYear

member.summary: Represents the individual batches of stock items checked in into a bin. It stores information about the quantity, the unit price, the batch date, the catalogue, etc.

Adjust the physical or available quantity upwards or downwards, only if the results of the adjustment of both fields do not fall below 0. This creates a StoreItemTransaction log and saves it.
Saves the item immediately when this method completes.

member.returns: The quantity adjusted.

Adjust the physical or available quantity upwards or downwards without creating a new transaction record.
This method should only be used during the cancellation of a store check-in/check-out/adjustment/transfer.

member.returns: The quantity adjusted.

member.summary:

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OFixedRate
member.summary: Represents a fixed rate item or a fixed rate group. A fixed rate item is a record describing services that can be provided by an external vendor to the user's company. When used in a purchase agreement, it indicates the services and the unit price that the vendor provides to the company when a purchase order is raised for those services to the vendor.

1 - Fixed Rate Item

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OFixedRate.LongDescription

[Column] Gets or sets the long description for this fixed rate item. This is represented as a TEXT field in the database, and has no limitation on the length. In contrast, the ObjectName field can only hold up to 255 characters.
This is applicable only if IsFixedRate = 1.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OWorkCost
member.summary: Represents the maintenance cost that will be incurred or has been incurred by the work.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.IsDeactivatable
member.summary:
This object is only deactivable if it has not been saved, or if this is not a Material cost type.
Returns true if deactivable, false otherwise. The UIGridview makes use of this field to hide and show the DeleteObject button accordingly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.Saving
member.summary:
This method is overriden to check-out items from the store when saving this work cost.
The application must be responsible for validating that the check-out is possible (given the physical balances in the store vs the number reserved items, etc).

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.HandlRemovedItems
member.summary: Handles items removed from the work cost.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.HandleCheckOut
member.summary:
If this is a store item, checks if there was a change in the actual quantity. Perform check-in/out if so.
Where applicable, this method must always be called BEFORE calling HandleReservation();

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.HandleReservation
member.summary:
If this is a store item, checks if there was a change in the estimated quantity. Perform reservation if so.
Where applicable, this method must always be called AFTER calling HandleCheckOut();

member.name: M:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.RecomputeEstimatedAndActualTotal
member.summary: Recompute the estimated and actual total. This should only be called after the cost has been updated.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.WorkID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Work table that indicates the work object that this cost item applies to.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.CostType
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates the type of the cost this cost item is classified under.
0 - Craft and technician.
1 - Obsolete, not used anymore.
2 - Others.
3 - Material ///

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.StoreID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Store table that indicates the store that the material will be checked out from. This is applicable only if CostType = 3.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.StoreBinID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the StoreBin table that indicates the bin that the material will be checked out from. This is applicable only if CostType = 3.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.StoreBinReservationID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the StoreBinReservation table that indicates the record used to indicate the reservation of the material at the store bin. This is applicable only if CostType = 3.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.CatalogueID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Catalogue table that indicates the record used to indicate the catalogue of the material that will be used in the work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.CraftID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Craft table that indicates the craft of the technician that will be assigned to this work. This is applicable only if CostType = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.UserID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the User table that indicates the in-house maintenance technician who will be assigned to this work. This is applicable only if CostType = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.FixedRateID
member.summary: [Column] This is obsolete and not in use.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.PartID
member.summary: [Column] This is obsolete and not in use.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.UnitOfMeasureID
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the foreign key to the Code table that indicates the unit of measure of this cost item. When CostType = 3 for material check-outs, this indicates the unit that the material will be checked out of the store in.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.CostDescription
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the description that of this cost item.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.EstimatedOvertime
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the technician is expected to work overtime for this work.
0 - No, technician is not expected to work overtime.
1 - Yes, technician is expected to work overtime.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.EstimatedUnitCost
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the estimated unit cost of this cost item. If CostType = 0, this represents the estimated hourly rate of technicians of the specified craft.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.EstimatedQuantity
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets estimated quantity required to complete maintenance of works created by this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.EstimatedCostFactor
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a cost factor applied to the cost to give the final cost.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.EstimatedCostTotal
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the estimated total for this cost item. This can be computed by taking EstimatedUnitCost x EstimatedCostFactor x EstimatedQuantity.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.ActualOvertime
member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the technician has worked overtime for this work.
0 - No, technician has not worked overtime.
1 - Yes, technician has worked overtime.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.ActualUnitCost
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the actual unit cost of this cost item. If CostType = 0, this represents the actual hourly rate of technicians of the specified craft.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.ActualQuantity
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets actual quantity required to complete maintenance of works created by this work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.ActualCostFactor
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a cost factor applied to the cost to give the final cost.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.ActualCostTotal
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the actual total for this cost item. This can be computed by taking ActualUnitCost x ActualCostFactor x ActualQuantity.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.ChargeOut
member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets the amount to charge the caller for this work. This is applicable only if the Work's IsChargedToCaller = 1.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.Store
member.summary: Gets or sets the OStore object that represents the store that the material will be checked out from. This is applicable only if CostType = 3.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.StoreBin
member.summary: Gets or sets the O object that represents the bin that the material will be checked out from. This is applicable only if CostType = 3.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.StoreBinReservation
member.summary: Gets or sets the OStoreBinReservation object that represents the record used to indicate the reservation of the material at the store bin. This is applicable only if CostType = 3.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.Catalogue
member.summary: Gets or sets the OCatalogue object that representsthe catalogue of the material that will be used in the work.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.Craft
member.summary: Gets or sets the OCraft object that represents craft of the technician that will be assigned to this work. This is applicable only if CostType = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.Technician
member.summary: Gets or sets the OUser object that represents the in-house maintenance technician who will be assigned to this work. This is applicable only if CostType = 0.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.FixedRate
member.summary: [Column] This is obsolete and not in use.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.UnitOfMeasure
member.summary: Gets or sets the O object that represents the unit of measure of this cost item. When CostType = 3 for material check-outs, this indicates the unit that the material will be checked out of the store in.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.EstimatedSubTotal
member.summary: Gets the estimated subtotal of this work. This is computed by taking EstimatedUnitCost x EstimatedCostFactor x EstimatedQuantity.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.ActualSubTotal
member.summary: Gets the actual subtotal of this work. This is computed by taking ActualUnitCost x ActualCostFactor x ActualQuantity.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.CraftStore
member.summary: Gets the name of the craft (if CostType = 0) or the name of the store (if CostType = 3).

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.CostTypeName
member.summary: Gets the localized text for the type of cost.

member.name: P:LogicLayer.OWorkCost.UnitOfMeasureText
member.summary: Gets the localized text for the 'hour' if CostType = 0 (craft/technician). Otherwise, gets the selected unit of measure's name.

member.name: T:LogicLayer.TContract
member.summary: Summary description for OVendor

member.name: T:LogicLayer.OContract
member.summary: Represents a contract between the user's company and the vendor providing services to the company. Through this contract the vendor may provide maintenance works at no extra cost to the company, or the vendor may provide a fixed set of rates (purchase agreement) to the company should the company purchase services or materials from the vendor in the future through a purchase order.

members.member:
--------------------------------------------------------------
Get the contracts that can apply to the work, and the contracts that apply are: 1. The work's scheduled start must be within contract's start/end date. 2. The work's type of service must be covered by the contract's type of service. 3. The work's location must be covered by at least one of the contract's specified location.
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
Get the contracts that can apply to the scheduled work, and the contracts that apply are: 1. The work's scheduled start must be within contract's start/end date. 2. The work's type of service must be covered by the contract's type of service. 3. The work's location must be covered by at least one of the contract's specified location.
--------------------------------------------------------------

--------------------------------------------------------------
Renew this current contract to a new contract with the exact same terms, but the contract start and end date of the new contract will take the current contract's 'renewed contract start/end date'.
--------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation
member.summary: Represents a request for quotation that can be used to gather quotations from vendors.

member.name: F:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.tempPurchaseBudgetSummaries
member.summary: A cached copy of the budget summary table that can be queried from the database

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.ComputeTempBudgetSummaries
member.summary: Computes the temporary list of budget summaries.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.SubmitForApproval
member.summary:
Submits for Request for Quotation for approval by doing:
1. Creates the budget transaction logs.
2. Creates the budget summaries and stamp them with the current budget available balance.
This method is called from the RFQ workflow after. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.Approve
member.summary:
Approves the Request for Quotation by doing the following:
1. Update all budget transactions to indicated Approved.
2. Create budget summaries if not already created.
3. Stamp budget summaries with current budget balance at approval.
This method is called from the workflow. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.Reject
member.summary:
Rejects the Request for Quotation by doing the following: 1. Cancels all budget transactions. 2. Clears all budget summaries.
This method is called from the workflow. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.Cancel
member.summary:
Cancels the Request for Quotation by doing the following: 1. Unlink all RFQ line items from the PR line items. 2. Cancel all budget transactions.
This method is called from the RFQ workflow after. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.Close
member.summary:
Closes the Request for Quotation by doing the following:
1. Cancels all budget transactions.
This method is called from the workflow. It should not be called by the developer directly.

member.summary: Gets the most applicable purchase settings and store it in a temporary variable.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.ValidateSufficientNumberOfQuotations
member.summary:
Validates that there are sufficient number of quotations for this request for qoutation.
This method returns
0 - if there is insufficient quotations.
1 - if there is sufficient quotations.
-1 - if there is insufficient quotations, and a warning will be shown.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.UpdateVendorAwardedItemsUnitPrice
member.summary: Updates the awarded items' unit price of all the RFQ items in this RFQ. This method should be called after the user updates the quotation of any of the vendors.

member.name: M:LogicLayer.ORequestForQuotation.ValidateBudgetAmountEqualsLineItemAmount
member.summary:
Validates that the budget amount is equals to the line item amount.
This function is generic and can be applied to any of the PR/RFQ/PO objects provided the line items implement the ItemNumber and the Amount properties.
member.returns: Returns -1 if the validation succeeds. Returns 0 if the total PR amount does not equal the budget amount . Returns any other number if that line number does not equal the budget amount

member.summary:
[Column] Gets or sets the budget distribution mode.
0 - Budget Distribution by Entire RFQ.
1 - Budget Distribution by RFQ line items.
Note that when the budget distribution is by an entire RFQ, then the user will be allowed to copy only the entire RFQ to a new PO, but will not be allowed to copy individual line items to a new PO.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag indicating that the request for quotation has been submitted for approval.

member.summary: [Column] Gets or sets a flag indicating that the request for quotation has been approved.
